title: Continuing Education Course: Painting, Pop, and Printmaking
short_description:
Five Saturdays
October 19–November 16
1:00–4:00

Andy Warhol used photography and screenprinting to create now-iconic works in the 1960s. In later years he produced multiples as well as unique works of art that expanded on this practice. In this five-week class, learn about Warhol’s techniques and source materials, visit a working print studio to better understand these processes, and situate his art in its 20th-century context.

Presented with the School of the Art Institute of Chicago

About the educator
Annie Morse is an independent art educator and curator who has worked with the Art Institute of Chicago, the Hyde Park Art Center, Columbia College Chicago and 3Arts, among other organizations. She earned a Master’s in 20th Century Art History, Theory and Criticism from the School of the Art Institute and a Master’s in Library and Information Science at the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign. 

Persons with disabilities who would like to request an accessibility accommodation for an Art Institute program are encouraged to send an e-mail to access@artic.edu two weeks in advance of the program.
location: School of the Art Institute of Chicago, 280 S. Columbus Drive building
